Captain-- Indeed, it is through battle that an
Arisen truly shows their worth. I am deeply
convinced of this.

column3:
ガルドリンが細々と賭けを持ちかけてくるんですよね
おかげで――いえ、なんでもありません！
column4:
Gurdolin keeps coming up with small bets, you
know. Thanks to that... Well, never mind!

column3:
戦いに慣れてから、時々ですけど、もっと刺激が
ほしいなんて、考えちゃうんですよ
column4:
After getting used to battles, sometimes, I can't
help but think that I want more excitement.

column3: ダメですよね、こういうこと考えちゃ
column4: It's not good, thinking about things like that.

column3:
ガルドリンのこと、いろんな人から聞くんですけど
どうやら最近は丸くなったというか
落ち着いたというか――
column4:
I hear about Gurdolin from various people, and it
seems that recently, they have become more
well-rounded, or rather, calmer.

column3:
最近のことしか知らない俺にしてみれば
これで！？　って感じですけどね
column4:
From my perspective, as someone who only knows
recent things, I have to say... is this it!? But
well, that's how I feel.

column3:
ジョゼフ様から聞く話に隊長が登場するようになって
どれくらい経つか忘れましたけど――
column4:
It has been some time since Captain made their
debut, or so it feels, as I heard from Sir Joseph.
But I can't exactly remember how long ago it was.

column3: 思うに、隊長って、全然変わってないですよね
column4:
In my opinion, the captain hasn't changed at all,
right?

column3:
リズって、ああ見えて、意外と世の中を
見てるんですよね
自分のことは見えていないようだけど
column4:
Lise looks like that, but she sees the world
surprisingly well.
She doesn't seem to see herself, though.

column3: なんでしょうか、隊長！
column4: What is it, Captain!

column3:
セシリーはいい子ですよねえ
力になってあげたいなあ
column4:
Cecily is a good girl, isn't she? I want to be
supportive.

column3:
隊長、急ぎましょう
何もかも、急ぎましょう
column4: Captain, let's hurry! with everything, I mean

column3:
早くセシリーを楽にしてあげないと
こっちまで息が詰まりそうです
column4:
We need to make Cecily feel better soon. I'm
choking up too!

column3:
まあ、楽にすると言っても
どうしたらいいかなんて
わからないんですけどね
column4:
Well, even if I say I want to make it easier, I
don't know what to do, you know?

column3:
騎士団には売れるだけ恩を売っておけなんていう
覚者もいますけど、俺に言わせれば
持ちつ持たれつですよ
column4:
Some Arisen believe in gaining favor with the
knight order as much as possible, but in my
opinion, it's all about mutual support.

column3:
売ったとか買ったとか、借りた貸したなんて
どうでもいいことです――
って、考えられる人になりたいんです、俺
column4:
Selling, buying, borrowing, lending... It's all
trivial stuff. I want to become someone who can
think about more important things—me.

column3:
時々、セシリーが思い詰めた顔をしていますよ？
なんとかしてあげられませんかねえ
もう、見ていられませんよ
column4:
Sometimes, Cecily has a troubled look on her
face, you know? Can't we do something to help her?
I can't bear to watch anymore.

column3:
隊長、レスタニアは広いですね
今回ばかりは痛感しています
column4:
Captain, Lestania is far, isn't it? I am feeling
this particularly keenly this time.

column3:
走っても、戦っても、尽きない敵
ええ、やりがいがありますよ！
column4:
Running, fighting, and endless enemies. Yes, it's
challenging!

column3: 俺、連戦でちょっと疲れちゃって――
column4: I'm a little tired from the consecutive battles...

column3:
もちろん、何かあれば動きますから
それ以外はここでジッとさせてください
column4:
Of course, if you need me to move, I'll move.
Otherwise, please let me stay put here.

column3:
俺は隊長の右腕を自認してますから
誰が戻ろうと、去ろうと、そこだけは
変わりませんからね
もちろん、ものすごく期待はしていますけど――
column4: Of course, I have really high expectations, but -

column3:
セシリーの記憶が戻っても問題が
解決するわけじゃないんですよね
鍛錬して、腕を磨いておこうかな
column4:
Even if Cecily's memory returns, it doesn't mean
the problem will be solved, right? Maybe I should
train and sharpen my skills.

column3: 黒騎士対策が急務ってところですかね
column4:
Is countermeasures against the Black Knight the
urgent matter here?

column3:
記憶が戻るとか、どうでも良くなりましたね
せめて意識が戻ってくれれば――
column4:
Back to memory, or whatever, it doesn't matter
anymore. At least if consciousness can return—

column3:
隊長、急ぎましょうよ
急いては事をし損じるなんて
言ってる場合じゃありません！
column4:
Captain, let's hurry up. There's no time to waste
by rushing. We can't afford to be talking about
it!

column3:
白竜様以外の竜の覚者と一緒に戦うなんて
こんな機会はもうないかもしれませんよね？
column4:
Isn't it unlikely to ever have the opportunity to
fight alongside any dragon's Arisen other than the
White Dragon?

column3:
隊長と一緒にいられるだけでも幸せなのに
その師匠筋のレオ統率の生き様まで
間近で見られて――俺、胸が熱いです
column4:
I am happy just being able to be with the
captain, And now, witnessing the way of life of
Leo up close... My heart is burning.

column3:
耳を澄ますと、聞き慣れない音がしますね
空気が濃くて、ねっとりとまとわりつくような――
column4:
When you listen carefully, you can hear
unfamiliar sounds. The air is thick and sticky, as
if it is enveloping you.

column3:
気にしすぎですかね――
やっぱり、ビビってるんですかね
column4:
Is it because I'm worrying too much - Am I just
being scared after all?

column3: ガルドリンは俺が見つけてみせますよ
column4: Gurdolin will be found

column3:
あの人は認めないでしょうけど
俺たち、結構、心が通じ合っているような
気がするんですよね
column4:
That person might not admit it, but I feel like
our hearts are somewhat connected, you know?

column3:
ロイグはどこでしょうね
ガルドリンも、はぐれたきりらしいですよ
column4: Where can Loeg be? Gurdolin also seems to be lost.

column3:
セシリーのお父さんは
それなりに強い戦士に育った娘の帰りを
待っていたのではないでしょうか？
column4:
I think Cecily's father was waiting for his
daughter to return after she grew up to be a
strong warrior in her own right.

column3:
本当は娘と一緒に行きたかったけど
いつまでも待っているわけにはいかず――
column4:
I really wanted to go with my daughter, but I
couldn't wait forever to--

column3:
とすれば、セシリーを早く帰してやれなかった
俺たちの責任も、あるのかもしれません
column4:
If that's the case, maybe it's our fault for not
getting Cecily home sooner.

column3:
族長が回復したらすぐに出発できるように
身体を温めておきましょう
電光石火の、雫奪回作戦です！
column4:
Once the clan chief has recovered, we can depart
immediately, so let's keep our bodies warm. It's
time for the lightning-fast operation to reclaim
the drop!

column3:
あははは
なんだかセシリーが大きく見えますよね
ここで居心地悪そうにしてた時とは
別人のようです
column4:
Ahahahaha!
Somehow, Cecily looks bigger, doesn't she?
She seems like a completely different person from
when she was feeling uncomfortable here.

column3:
フィンダムの中心部に向かうんですよね
しかも、世界を救うために――
これって、凄いことだなあ
column4:
We're heading to the heart of Phindym,
And to save the world--
This is awesome!

column3:
さあ、まだ魔物はいますよ！
休んでいるヒマなんてありません
column4:
Well, there are still enemies here!
There is no time to rest.

column3:
胸騒ぎが止まりません――
なんでしょう、これ
column4: I can't stop the excitement— What is this?

column3:
わははは！
隊長、もう感情を抑えられません
早く決めちゃいましょう！
column4:
Wahaha! Captain, I can't contain my emotions
anymore. Let's decide quickly!

column3:
理というのは――
見方によっちゃあ、酷なものですね
column4:
Depending on how you look at it, order can be a
cruel thing, you know.

column3:
俺たちをここに連れてきた竜の思惑なんて
わかりませんけど、アッカーシェランには
俺たちの援助が必要です
column4:
I don't understand the intentions of the dragon
that brought us here, but Acre Selund needs our
assistance.

column3: 俺は、そう確信しています！
column4: I am convinced of that!

column3: この状況、俺たちで変えて見せましょう！
column4:
Let's change this situation, and show what we can
do!

column3: 王子はどこですかねえ
column4: Where is the prince, I wonder?

column3:
聞くところによると西方はなかなか
厄介な地域らしいですよ
column4:
According to reports, the western region is said
to be quite troublesome area.

column3: 王家の威光もあまり届いていないとか
column4:
The royal family's authority does not seem to
reach very far.

column3:
隊長、アッカーシェランの歴史や政治とは
距離を置いた方が得策ですよね
column4:
Captain, it's in your best interest to keep your
distance from Acre Selund's history and politics

column3:
王子救出に夢中になっていましけど
“悪しき竜”はどこにいるんでしょうね
column4:
I'm currently focused on rescuing the prince, but
where could the "Evil Dragon" be?

column3: 邪魔する気もないみたいですし
column4: And they don't seem to want to interfere.

column3:
王子はまだまだ子供で頼りないけど
そのおかげで解放軍は一丸となる――
column4:
The prince is still a child and unreliable, but
thanks to that, the liberation army will unite as
one.

column3:
俺でさえ、守ってやりたいと
思いますからね
column4: Even I, want to protect you.

column3:
ネド王子、王子らしくあろうとして
無理してる気がするんですけど
隊長、どう思います？
column4:
Prince Nedo, I feel like he's trying to be more
like a prince and forcing himself. Captain, what
do you think?

column3:
武器、防具――装備品、全ての手入れは
完璧です！
column4:
Weapons, armor--equipment, all taken care of
perfectly!

column3: “悪しき竜”の言葉を覚えていますか？
column4: Do you remember the words of the "Evil Dragon"?

column3:
絶望の大陸を楽しめって――
俺たち、挑発されてますよ？
乗ってやりましょうか！？
column4:
"Enjoy the Land of Despair" - we are being
provoked. Shall we ride?!

column3:
休める時には休む
これ、俺たちよく忘れちゃいますよね
column4: Rest when you can. We often forget this!

column3:
休める時には休む
これ、俺たちよく忘れちゃいますよね
column4:
Rest when you can.
We often forget this!

column3: やっぱり覚者は戦ってこそ、ですね
column4: After all, an Arisen should fight.

column3:
これも広い意味で白竜様をお守りする
覚者ならではの戦いですから
column4:
This is also a battle in the broad sense of
protecting the White Dragon, that only the Arisen
can fight.

column3:
ジョゼフ様じゃありませんが――
事がうまく運ぶほど“悪しき竜”の
動向が気になっちゃいますね
column4:
I'm not Joseph, but--
the more things go well, the more I wonder what
the "evil dragon" is up to.

column3:
解放軍が増員されれば俺たちの負担も
多少は減るでしょうから、黒い騎士のことは
その時に考えましょう
column4:
If the liberation army is increased, our burden
will be reduced, so let's think about the black
knight at that time!

column3:
鎧の中身が誰だろうと目の前に現れたら
俺は戦うだけですよ！
column4: Why, in such a state...

column3:
隊長、どうしましょう
何から手をつけていいのか――
column4:
Captain, what should we do I don't even know
where to start--

column3:
早くなんとかしないと俺たちまで
動けなくなりますね
column4:
If we don't do something soon, even we will
become unable to move.

column3:
やりましょう、隊長
俺、レスタニアもアッカーシェランも
全部引き受けますよ！
column4:
Let's do it, Captain.
I'll take care of Lestania, Acre Selund,
I'll take care of everything!

column3:
黒騎士を倒して白竜様の力と
メガドを取り戻しましょう！
column4:
Let's defeat the Black Knight and restore the
power of the White Dragon and Megado!

column3:
いやー、なんか、鼻歌出ちゃいますよ
ついつい浮かれちゃうんです
column4:
Well, somehow, a song just slips out.
I can't help but get carried away.

column3: ネド王子が我々と離れたがっている――
column4: Prince Nedo wants to leave us—

column3:
これまでの経緯を思うと
それは考えにくいですよね
column4:
Given what we've been through,
that's unlikely.

column3:
この時間に何かできることが
あるかもしれませんね？
column4:
At this time, there may be something we can do,
right?

column3:
体力増強とか地勢確認とか――
考えてみましょうか
column4:
Maybe we should think about increasing our
strength, or checking the terrain--

column3:
俺はいつ、どんな時でも隊長の右腕です
頼りにしてくださいね
column4:
I'm the captain's right hand man whenever and
however you need me.
You can count on me.

column3:
大丈夫ですってば！
みんな心配しすぎですよ
column4:
I'm fine!
Everyone is worrying too much.

column3:
あははは――
少し張り切り過ぎました
column4:
Ahahaha――
I got a little too carried away.

column3:
落ち着いたらキノザのお湯に浸かって
養生するつもりです
column4:
Once I get settled down, I plan to soak in the
Kinoza hot spring for recuperation.

column3:
まだ勝手がわからなくてね
無礼があったら教えてくれ
column4:
I'm still getting the hang of this. Let me know
if I'm being rude.

column3:
わたしがここにいる意味――
それをね、ずっと考えているんだ
column4: I've been thinking about what I'm here for.

column3: 君たちから学ぶべきことは本当に多いよ
column4: I really have a lot to learn from you guys.

column3:
幾つもの出会いが――
わたしをここまで連れてきたのだろうね
column4: How many encounters have brought me here?

column3:
わたしも覚者だったら――
君たちを見ているとそう思わずにはいられない
column4:
If I were also an Arisen―― I can't help but think
that when I look at all of you.

column3:
人生の分岐路なんて、通過してみないと
わからないものだね――最近、そう思うんだ
column4:
You don't know the crossroads of life until you
pass through them; that's what I've been thinking
lately.

column3:
――ああ、失礼
昔のことをね――故郷のことを思い出していた
column4:
Ah, excuse me, I was reminiscing about the old
days, thinking about my hometown.

column3:
人は変わるね――ああ、良くも悪くも
変わるものさ
column4:
People change――Ah, for better or worse
We change

column3: なんだろう
column4: I wonder what it is.

column3:
レオはいい奴だ
付き合いが浅くても、それだけはわかるよ
column4:
Leo is a good guy. Even though we don't know each
other well, that much is clear.

column3:
少し休ませてくれ
いろいろ考えたいんだ
column4: I need some rest. I've got a lot to think about.

column3: セシリーは眠っているようにしか見えないな
column4: Cecily looks like she's asleep.

column3:
セシリーは助かるんだろう？
君たちが動いているんだから不安はない
そう言い聞かせてはいるんだけどね
column4: Wishing you good luck!

column3:
セシリーが元気になって本当に良かった
わたしの提案が彼女を危機に追いやった
わけだからね
column4:
I'm glad Cecily has regained her health. It was
my suggestion that put her in crisis, so that's
why.

column3:
ああこの空気――
やっぱりたまらなくおいしいよ
column4:
Ah, this sky―― After all, it's irresistibly
delicious.

column3:
娘から色々と聞いたが――
わたしも一度はレスタニアを見たいものだ
column4:
My daughter has told me so much about it— I wish
I could see Lestania at least once.

column3:
フィンダムは変わりつつある
暮らす者たちの意識は確実に変わっている
column4:
Phindym is changing.
The attitude of the people living here is
definitely changing.

column3:
芯なる樹が病めば、竜も、大地も
人も、魔物さえも病んでしまう
column4:
If the core tree falls ill, the dragons and the
earth will also suffer. Even humans, and the
monsters, will fall ill!

column3: そう――全ては巡る竜力で繋がっているのだ
column4:
That's right—Everything is connected by the power
of the dragons.

column3:
今にして思えばとても奇妙に思えるのだ
なぜ魔物と戦うように、病魔や厄災と
戦おうとしなかったのか――
column4:
Thinking about it now, it seems very strange.
Why didn't I try to fight against sickness and
disaster,
just as I would fight against enemies?

column3:
フィンダムはもうずいぶん犠牲を払ったはずだが――
まだまだ足りないのだろうか
column4:
Phindym must have sacrificed a lot already -
Is it still not enough?

column3:
あの黒騎士が、どこから来たのか――
この凶事は黒騎士の仕業なのだろうか――
column4:
Where did that black knight come from—Is the
black knight responsible for this evil?

column3:
黒騎士が凶事に便乗したのか――
して、その目的は？　わからぬことばかりだ
column4:
Did the Black Knight take advantage of the
calamity? And what is their goal? I can't
understand anything.

column3:
――セシリーは良い子だろう？
わたしの自慢の娘だ
column4:
--Isn't Cecily a good girl?
I'm very proud of her.

column3: それなのに、途方もない重荷を負わせてしまったな
column4:
And yet, I ended up burdening you with an
enormous load.

column3:
不思議なものだ
この、病み、淀んだ空気にも馴れてしまうものだな
column4:
It's strange. You become accustomed even to this
sickly, stagnant atmosphere.

column3:
精霊竜ウィルミアは美しく愛らしい竜だ
今でも目を閉じると、優雅に飛ぶ姿が目に浮かぶ
column4:
The spirit dragon Willmia is a beautiful and
lovely dragon. Even now, when I close my eyes, I
can see its graceful flying figure.

column3: レスタニアの人よ、なんなりと
column4: Lestania's people, anything you want.

column3:
レスタニアの覚者たちよ
心苦しい限りだが、このフィンダム
まだまだ安定への道半ば――
column4:
Arisen of Lestania, As much as it pains me, this
is a Phindym Still halfway on the path to
stability...

column3: 最後まで、我々とともに歩んでくれ
column4: Please continue to walk with us, until the end

column3: 《原始の雫》とセシリーを頼んだよ
column4: Rely on the "Primeval Drops" and Cecily.

column3:
樹内への侵入者という意味では
我々も、魔物もそれほど違わない
もし、ウィルミアに攻撃されたら――
そうだな、全力で逃げるのが得策だろう
column4:
In terms of intruders into the forest, both us
and the enemy are not much different. If we are
attacked by Willmia-- Yeah, it would be best to
escape with all our strength.

column3:
浄化はすでに始まっているのだが――
想像以上に時間がかかるようだ
column4:
The purification has already begun - but it seems
to be taking longer than anticipated.

column3:
もう何もいうまい
これはさだめだ
抗うことを許されない種類のさだめもある
column4:
I have nothing more to say.
This is fate.
There are types of fate that are not allowed to
be resisted.

column3:
今はただ待とう――
娘はまた帰ってくる
column4:
I will simply wait for now; my daughter will come
home again.

column3: 竜として生まれ変わってな
column4: To be reborn as a dragon.

column3: さあ、早く為すべき事を！
column4: Now, quickly do what needs to be done!

column3:
我々はずっとここにいるし、あなたたちの
応援をしているよ
column4: We'll be here all the way, supporting you!

column3: 話すことなどない
column4: There is nothing to say anymore.

column3: 身の程を知れ
column4: Know your place.

column3: 聞く耳持たぬわ
column4: I refuse to listen to you.

column3: 消えろ
column4: Disappear.

column3: 笑止――
column4: Ridiculous...

column3: 耳障りな声だ
column4: Such an annoying voice.

column3: 思い上がるな
column4: Don't get conceited.

column3: 自惚れるな
column4: Don't be conceited.

column3: 半端覚者め――失せろ
column4: You half-baked Arisen—Disappear.

column3: 貴様らの世界観で我が遠謀深慮ははかれぬ
column4: Our cunning cannot be understood by your worldview

column3: ふん、身の程知らずめ
column4: Ignorant fool, know your place.

column3:
アッカーシェランは、本当は良いところなんです
落ち着いたら案内させてくださいね
column4:
Acre Selund is actually a nice place. Please let
me guide you once you settle down.

column3: 悪しき竜は憎き敵――国の仇です
column4:
The Evil Dragon is a hated enemy - the nation's
foe.

column3:
けれども、隊長さんたちと会わせてくれたこと――
これだけは感謝しています
column4:
However, I am grateful for allowing me to meet
with the captains.

column3:
いつもなんのおもてなしもできずに
申し訳ありません――ごめんなさい
column4:
I apologize for not being able to provide any
hospitality. I'm sorry.

column3: ジリアンは本当に頼りになります
column4: Gillian is really reliable.

column3:
このアッカーシェランには他にもあのような
勇気ある人がいるのでしょうか
column4:
Are there any other brave people like that in
Acre Selund?

column3:
僕は王子なのですが、王族としての教育半ばで
城にいられなくなってしまいました
column4:
I am a prince, but I had to leave the castle
halfway through my royal education.

column3: 不作法があったら――お詫びします
column4: If there was any rudeness— I apologize.

column3:
メイロワ将軍は王家の一番の家臣です
困ったことがあったらメイロワに言ってくださいね
column4:
General Meirova is the king's most loyal
retainer. If you have any trouble, please let
Meirova know.

column3:
悪しき竜に荒らされたアッカーシェラン――
みんなで力を合わせて元に戻すんです！
column4:
Acre Selund has been ravaged by The Evil Dragon--
We all have to work together to restore it!

column3: 僕には病で命を落とした姉がいました
column4: I had a sister who passed away from illness.

column3:
姉が王座を継ぐと思っていたので――
内緒ですよ？　こんな立場に戸惑っています
column4:
I thought my sister would inherit the throne, so--
It's a secret, you know? I'm confused in this
position.

column3: 隊長、エリオット、ガルドリン、リズ――
column4: Captain, Elliot, Gurdolin, Lise—

column3:
たとえこの先に、何が起ころうと
皆さんの名前はアッカーシェランの歴史に
刻まれることでしょう
column4:
Whatever happens next, your names will be etched
in Acre Selund's history.

column3:
天はその者に耐えられる苦難しか与えない
と聞きます
column4:
Heaven only bestows hardships that one can
endure, or so I hear

column3:
どう思いますか？
たとえ思いはどうあれ、その通りだと
言ってくださいね
column4:
What do you think? No matter what you think,
please say it exactly as it is.

column3: はい、僕に用でしょうか？
column4: Yes, you wanted to see me?

column3:
覚者として――そして戦士として
いろいろ教えてくださいね
column4:
As an Arisen--and a warrior, I hope you can teach
me a lot!

column3:
陣の奧で守られているだけなんて
僕はいやですから
column4:
Yes, I don't want to just be protected at the
back of the battlefield.

column3:
隊長さん、僕は人々の希望であらねば
なりません
column4: Captain, I must be the hope of the people

column3:
それには、どう振る舞えばよいのか――
なかなかの難問です
column4:
And how should one behave in that situation? It's
quite a difficult problem.

column3:
緊張しますね
いくさはいつもこうなのですか？
column4:
I'm nervous, aren't you? Is it always like this
before a battle?

column3:
僕はまだまだです
もっともっと強くならなくてはなりません
column4:
I am still lacking. I must become stronger, much
stronger.

column3:
秘密の入り口が見つかったら
あとは任せてください
column4:
Once you find the secret entrance
we'll take care of the rest.

column3: 扉の先は必ず展望城へと通じているはずです
column4:
The path beyond the door must lead to Lookout
Castle.

column3:
少なくとも、王家の秘密の扉は
存在したわけですから
column4:
At the very least, the secret door of the royal
family existed.

column3:
隊長さん、ありがとうございます
ここまで来られたのも隊長さんたちの
おかげです
column4:
Thank you, Captain. It's thanks to you all that
we've made it this far.

column3:
こうして再び展望城に立つことができるとは――
感慨無量です
column4:
To be able to stand in Lookout Castle again like
this ―― it's an indescribable feeling.

column3:
隠れている同志を見つけ出すと同時に
不安な日々を送ってきた人々に
僕たちが来ていることを知らせる目的もあります
column4:
The purpose is to find our comrades in hiding and
at the same time to let those who have been living
in uncertainty know that we are coming!

column3: よろしくお願いします！
column4: Nice to meet you!

column3:
僕は各所の兵たちを回って声をかけたら
石塔のところで皆さんをお待ちします
column4:
I'll go around to all the soldiers in the various
locations and call them out.
I'll meet you all at the stone tower.

column3:
僕は各所の兵たちを回って声をかけたら
石塔のところで皆さんをお待ちします
column4:
I'll go around to all the soldiers in the various
locations and call them out.
I'll meet you all at the stone tower.

column3:
ああ隊長さん
いてくれると心強いです！
column4:
Oh Captain,
It's reassuring to have you here!

column3:
さあ、みなさん
思いを果たして白竜様のもとへ！
column4:
Now, everyone,
Let's fulfill our wishes and go to The White
Dragon!

column3:
ああ隊長さん
落ち着いたら将軍やジリアンと一緒に
レスタニアにお邪魔しますからね
column4:
Oh Captain,
when things settle down, I'll be visiting you and
the General and Gillian in Lestania!

column3:
白竜様やジョゼフ様にお礼とご挨拶を
しなくてはなりません
column4:
I have to express my gratitude and greetings to
Lord White Dragon and Master Joseph

column3: エリオットは一見頼りないけど、腕は立つ
column4: Elliot is seemingly unreliable, but he is skilled.

column3: レスタニア者は一筋縄ではいかないね
column4: Lestania citizens are not easy to deal with.

column3: リズはああ見えて、かなりしっかりした子だね
column4:
Lise, believe it or not, is a pretty reliable
girl.

column3: 人は見かけによらない――そんな言葉を思い出したよ
column4: Appearances are deceiving--I remember that saying.

column3: ガルドリンは――見たとおりの人物のようだ
column4: Gurdolin--seems to be exactly what he looks like.

column3:
言葉の荒さも人の良さを隠すためのもの
まるでアッカーシェランの男のようにわかりやすい
column4:
The harshness of words is also a means to conceal
one's goodness, just like a man from Acre Selund,
it is easy to understand.

column3:
隊長――あなたは不思議な人だな
あなたならなんとかしてくれる
――そう思わせてくれるよ
column4:
Captain ―― you are an intriguing person I believe
you can do something ―― You make me think that
way.

column3:
そういう人のことを、このアッカーシェランでは
“竜に愛されてる”と言うのさ
column4:
We in Acre Selund call such a person "loved by
the dragon."

column3:
レスタニアも同じだろうけど
このアッカーシェランにも長い歴史があってね――
column4:
Lestania is probably the same but Acre Selund
also has a long history—

column3:
たいていは家と家、人と魔物の対立の歴史なんだ
竜との対立なんて初めてのことさ
column4:
Usually, it is a history of conflict between
houses and houses, and people and monsters. It's
the first time there's been a conflict with
dragons.

column3:
わたし、悪しき竜が現れるまでは野や山を見ても
何も思わなかったんだ
column4:
Until the evil dragon appeared, I didn't think
anything of the fields and mountains.

column3:
だけどね
自由に歩き回れるわけじゃなくなってからは
愛おしくてたまらない――勝手だよね
column4:
But you know, ever since I can no longer freely
wander around,
I cherish it so much――it's selfish, isn't it?

column3: レスタニアには覚者が大勢いるんだろう？
column4: Are there a lot of Arisen in Lestania?

column3:
みんな強いのか？　一流の戦士なのか？
白翼覚者隊という生え抜きの部隊もあるんだよね
column4:
Are they all strong? Are they first-class
warriors?
There's also a freshly minted unit called the
White Wing Arisen Corps.

column3: ――戦いが、いっぱいあるんだな
column4: -- I'm sure there's a lot of fighting going on.

column3: 白竜は長く病んでいると聞いている
column4:
I have heard that The White Dragon has been ill
for a long time.

column3:
早く良くなるといいな
竜はいつでも心身ともに健やかでいてくれないと
世が闇に覆われてしまうようだ
column4:
I hope you get better soon.
The world seems to be covered in darkness if the
dragon is not always healthy both mentally, and
physically.

column3: えーと、なに？
column4: Um, what?

column3:
こっちにいる間はわたしと一緒に
行動してもらうからね
column4: You'll be working with me while you're here.

column3:
将軍がいれば全体の士気もあがる
そういう人だよ、メイロワ将軍は
column4:
Having a general boosts overall morale. That's
the kind of person General Meirova is.

column3:
ネド王子とは、将軍に連れられて
挨拶に行って――それだけ
column4:
Prince Nedo and I were taken by the General to
greet him—that's it.

column3:
それでも、王子のためなら
戦えるし、王子を思えば希望を抱ける
column4:
Still, if it's for the prince, I can fight, and
if I think of the prince, I can hold onto hope.

column3:
――みんな同じさ
王家は、そういう一族なんだ
column4:
-- all the same. The Royals are that kind of
family.

column3:
今はネド王子が最優先
それ以外は考えたくないの
column4:
Right now, Prince Nedo is the top priority. I
don't want to think about anything else.

column3:
王子は状況に屈することなく
積極的に動いているみたいだね
column4:
The prince seems to be actively moving forward
without succumbing to the circumstances.

column3:
頼もしいと言えば頼もしいけど
本音を言うと――いや、やめておくよ
column4:
I'd say you're reliable, but... To tell you the
truth--no, I shouldn't.

column3:
ネド王子と一緒の時間を作ってよ
良き助言者になってほしい
column4:
Make time to be with Prince Ned.
Be a good advisor.

column3:
オークどもの動きが活発だ
ふん、“悪しき竜”の言いなりのくせに
column4:
The Orcs are quite active, huh? Hmph, even though
they're under the control of the "Evil Dragon".

column3:
アッカーシェラン全土のオークが
動き始めたら、こっちも戦力を
分散する必要があるから――マズいね
column4:
If all the orcs in Acre Selund start moving,
we'll need to disperse our forces as well - that's
not good.

column3:
“悪しき竜”が現れたってね
今度来たら、逃がさないよ
column4:
I heard an "evil dragon" showed up. If he comes
again, I won't let him get away.

column3:
イェルハルドの近くで戦うのは
とても勉強になるよ
column4: Fighting near Gerhard is very educational.

column3:
イェルハルドの近くで戦うのは
とても勉強になるよ
column4: Fighting near Gerhard is very educational.

column3:
戦いが終わったらさ――
城で会おうね
column4:
When the battle is over—I'll see you at the
castle.

column3:
はあ――いいね、やっぱり
この城は、落ち着くよ
column4: Ha--good, I knew it. This castle is so relaxing!

column3: ここに来て解放軍を増強できそうなんだ
column4:
It seems like we can strengthen the Liberation
Army by coming here.

column3:
人数が増えると作戦の選択肢も増えるし
あなたたちの負担も減るからね
column4:
The more people we have, the more operational
options we have, and the less work you guys have
to do.

column3:
わたしたちはとにかく城内を駆け回って
混乱を誘いつつ敵の部隊を削る――いい？
column4:
We will run around inside the castle, causing
confusion and chipping away at the enemy's
forces—sound good?

column3: ここにいてもいいの？
column4: Is it okay if I stay here?

column3: 借りを返すときが来たようだね
column4: It seems that the time has come to repay the debt.

column3: そっちも、こっちも、とりあえず一段落だね
column4:
Both there and here, we have made some progress
for now.

column3:
王子はアッカーシェランのただひとりの
覚者なんだ
column4: The Prince is the only Arisen of Acre Selund.

column3:
王子の気持ち、わたしたちの気持ちが
どうあっても、選択肢はないよね
column4:
The prince's feelings, our feelings, no matter
what, there is no option.

column3:
焦っても仕方がないよね
――そう自分に言い聞かせてるよ
column4:
There's no point in rushing -- that's what I keep
telling myself.

column3:
ふと気づくと、あなたたちに頼っている
自分に気づいて、あれ？って思うんだよね
column4:
When you suddenly realize, you depend on yourself
and think, huh? When I suddenly realize it, I find
myself relying on you guys. I become aware of
myself and think, "Huh?"

column3: 王子も――そんな風に考えたのかな
column4: Did the prince also think that way?

column3:
悪しき竜との決戦がすぐそこにあるのに
気になることが多すぎるの
column4:
The battle against the Evil Dragon is right
around the corner, but there are too many things
that I'm worried about.

column3:
死ぬかもしれないんだから、スッキリして
おきたいけど――贅沢なのかな
column4:
Since I might die, I want to feel refreshed, but
is that being extravagant?

column3: いよいよ決戦――
column4: Finally, the decisive battle—.

column3:
静かに、ギュッと――
覚悟を固めているのさ
column4: Quietly, firmly—I'm steeling my resolve.

column3:
こっちの状況が落ち着いたら
かならず訪ねていくから――
column4:
Once this situation here settles down, I will
definitely come to visit.

column3: 案内してくれる？
column4: Can you show me around?

column3:
こんなこと
苦しんでいる民たちにはけして言えないが
column4:
I can't say this to the people who are suffering,
but...

column3:
おぬしたちのような戦士たちとともに戦えるのは
武人の誉れ、喜びだ
column4:
It is an honor and joy to fight alongside
warriors like us. Soldiers.

column3:
アッカー家の方々は家臣を大切にする家柄
その恩に報いることが今のわしの責務
column4:
The Acre family values their retainers,
And it is now my duty to repay their kindness.

column3:
おぬし達は、そんなわしへの贈り物にちがいない
贈り主のことは考えないようにするよ
column4:
You all are undoubtedly a gift for someone like
me. Let's not think about the giver.

column3:
ジリアンはわしの孫だ
こんなことになるまで、ほとんど話したことも
なかったが
娘に似て良い子に育ったわ
column4:
Gillian is my granddaughter. We hardly talked
much until it came to this, but she has grown up
to be a good child, just like her mother.

column3: よいか、本人には内緒だぞ
column4: Listen, it's a secret from them.

column3:
おぬしは良い部下に恵まれておるな
いや、仲間というべきかな
column4:
You are blessed with good subordinates. No,
perhaps it's better to say comrades.

column3: わしの人生はもう夕暮れ時だ
column4: My life is already in its twilight.

column3:
これまで面白おかしく生かしてくれた
このアッカーシェランに恩返しをしないうちには
立ち去るわけにはいかんのだ
column4:
Up until now, you have made my life interesting
and enjoyable. Before I leave Acre Selund, I must
express my gratitude.

column3:
歳を取るのは悪くないと思ってここまで生きてきたが
こんな危機の最中にジジイでいるのは――
まったく、運命が恨めしいわ
column4:
I have lived thinking that getting older is not a
bad thing, but to be an old man in the midst of
such a crisis... Oh, how I resent my fate.

column3: レスタニアでもオークは臭いらしいな
column4: I hear orcs stink in Lestania too.

column3:
臭いのはこの地のオークだけなら
なんと不公平なことかと
天を呪ってやるところだったぞ
column4:
If it were only the orcs here that smelled, I
would have cursed the heavens for how unfair it
was.

column3:
おぬしほどの者がこの国にいたら
わしは喜んで将軍の座を譲るつもりだ
column4:
But if someone as capable as you were in this
country, I would gladly give up my position as
general.

column3:
そしてわしは、大将軍を名乗るのだ！
はははは！
column4:
And thus, I shall proclaim myself as the Supreme
General! Hahaha!

column3:
人をジジイ扱いする若造に手厳しく仕返しするのが
わしの楽しみでな
column4:
It's my pleasure to give a harsh retaliation to
the young people who treat me like an old man.

column3:
だが、わしは有名になりすぎた
わしのことを誰も知らぬ土地へ行って
若造どもをからかい倒してやりたいわ
column4:
However, I became too famous. I want to go to a
land where no one knows me and make fools of those
youngsters.

column3: おお、そうだな
column4: Oh, I see.

column3: 王子とは必ず再会できる
column4: Prince's reunion is guaranteed.

column3:
おぬしらもそう信じてくれ
信じればそれは実現するというではないか
column4:
You all too believe in that. It is said that if
you believe, it will come true.

column3:
気が急くのう――
いかし、急いては事をし損じるというからな
column4:
I'm in a hurry-- But, after all, they say haste
makes waste.

column3:
イェルハルドを悪く思わないでくれ
あれもまた忠義の男だ
column4:
Please do not think badly of Gerhard.
He is also a loyal man.

column3:
おぬしたちのことはネド王子には
良く言っておくからな
わしに任せておけ
column4:
I will make sure to speak well of you all to
Prince Nedo. Leave it to me.

column3:
ここだけの話、王子が覚者でなければ
その事実、隠し通すつもりでいたが――
column4:
Confidentially speaking, if the prince isn't an
Arisen,
I had intended to conceal that fact--

column3: 胸を撫で下ろしたわい
column4: I breathed a sigh of relief.

column3:
これから先もよろしく頼むぞ
戦慣れしたおぬしらの力が
ぜひとも必要だ
column4:
I kindly ask for your continued support in the
future. Your experience and skills in battle are
indispensable.

column3:
解放軍は少数精鋭
大軍の真っ向ぶつかり合いなど
考えちゃいない
column4:
The Liberation Army is an elite few and they
don't even think about the head-to-head clashes of
large armies.

column3: おぬしら、期待しているぞ
column4: I'm expecting great things from you.

column3: 慎重に――慎重に事を進めるぞ
column4: Careful--proceed with caution.

column3:
わしが焦っているように見えたら
おぬしら、遠慮無く諫めてくれよ
column4:
If it appears that I am being impatient, please
do not hesitate to admonish me.

column3:
ふーむ
王家の秘密は記録に残さないのが習わし
地図すらないのだ
column4:
Hmmm, royal secrets are not supposed to be
recorded. We don't even have a map!

column3:
ふーむ
王家の秘密は記録に残さないのが習わし
地図すらないのだ
column4:
Hmmm
Royal secrets are not supposed to be recorded
We don't even have a map!

column3:
展望城の城主はネド・アッカー様
そのことをオークどもに思い出させてやるわ
column4:
The lord of Lookout Castle is Prince Nedo Acre. I
will remind those Orcs of that.

column3:
難攻不落と思われたこの城も
あっさりと“悪しき竜”に落とされた
その口惜しさが、わしの原動力だ
column4:
This fortress, which was thought to be
impregnable, was easily taken down by the "Evil
Dragon." The frustration of that defeat is my
driving force.

column3:
敗北は人を強くする
身をもって知ったぞ
column4: Defeat makes us stronger. I've seen it firsthand.

column3:
具体的な話はジリアンから聞いてくれ
もちろんネド王子を尊重してくれよ
column4:
Please listen to Gillian for the specific
details. And of course, please respect Prince
Nedo.

column3: 頼むぞ、レスタニアの強者たちよ
column4: I'm counting on you, strong warriors of Lestania.

column3:
たとえ敵の手に落ちようとも、さすが王都
攻略は容易ではないわい
column4:
Even if it falls into the hands of the enemy, it
is indeed a royal city that will not be easy to
conquer!

column3:
黒騎士はおぬしらに任せるぞ
それが望みであろう？
column4:
I'll leave the black knight to you. That's what
you want, isn't it?

column3:
レスタニアの白竜様はその力を
取り戻したと聞く
column4:
I hear that the White Dragon of Lestania has
regained its power.

column3: 本当に良かったなあ
column4: I'm really glad.

column3: 王子の行動がさっぱりわからん
column4: I can't understand the prince's actions at all.

column3:
――しかし、わしは王子を信じると決めた
おぬしらも王子を見捨てることなく
よろしく頼むぞ
column4:
-- But I have decided to trust the prince, and I
hope you will not abandon him.

column3:
すまんな――
わしが謝っても意味はなかろうが
今はこれしか言えん
column4:
I'm sorry――
Even if I apologize, it probably won't mean much,
But right now, this is all I can say.

column3:
王子は気が触れたわけでも
心を奪われたわけでもない
となれば、わしの気持ちは決まっている
column4:
The prince is neither crazy nor has he lost his
mind. If that's the case, my feelings are already
decided.

column3:
たとえそれが大きな過ちだとしても不安はないぞ
おぬしらがいるからな
column4:
Even if it's a big mistake, I have no worries
Because you are here.

column3:
ああ忙しい
やることはいっぱいなのに
気が急いて何もできんわ！
column4:
Oh, I'm so busy, I have so much to do! I'm in
such a rush I can't get anything done!

column3: もう進むしかない
column4: There's no choice but to move forward.

column3:
理想はまずネド王子の保護だが
決戦と同時になっても良しとせねばなるまい
時は来たのだ
column4:
The first priority is the protection of Prince
Nedo, but we must also be prepared for the
decisive battle. The time has come.

column3:
王子と相談して決めねばねばならんことが
多々あるのだ
まだまだ休むわけにはいかない
column4:
There are many things that I need to discuss with
the prince.
I can't afford to rest just yet.

column3:
まあ、アッカーシェランのための多忙は
本懐だがな
column4:
Well, being busy for Acre Selund is my true
calling.

column3:
わたしの故郷、ロスギルは古来より魔物の多い土地
よってこう見えて、そこそこ戦えると自負しています
column4:
My hometown, Rothgill, has been a land of demons
since ancient times.
So, although I look like this, I am proud to say
that I can fight well!

column3: いつか、手合わせ願いたいものですね
column4: I hope to have a chance to spar with you someday.

column3:
若い頃はメイロワ将軍の思いつきのような言動に
振り回されましたが
おかげで身も心も鍛えられましたよ
column4:
When I was younger, I was swept away by General
Meyrowa's thoughtful words and actions, his
impetuous words and deeds. But it has strengthened
me both physically and mentally.

column3:
戦略、戦術――
そんなものが役に立つのは相手が人間の時だけです
column4:
Strategies, tactics--
such things are only useful when the opponent is
human!

column3:
いや、オークならば、かろうじて通用するでしょう
しかし、悪しき竜相手では、果たして――
column4:
No, if it's an Orc, it will barely work. However,
when facing the Evil Dragon, I wonder if it will
be effective...

column3:
解放軍とは言っても、寄せ集めです
勝利に欠かせない執念や忠義心の強さは人それぞれ
column4:
Even though they're called the Liberation Army,
they're just a ragtag group. Everyone has their
own determination and loyalty that they can't do
without for victory.

column3:
訓練による意思統一も難しい状況の中で
人々を鼓舞するのは勝利そのものが持つ力に他ならず
column4:
In the midst of a difficult situation where it is
also challenging to achieve unity through
training, the ability to inspire people lies
solely in the power that victory itself holds.

column3: 親鳥が先か卵が先か――みたいな話ですけどね
column4:
It's like the chicken and the egg problem, you
know.

column3:
ほんの一握りの勇気など、悪しき竜のひと啼きで
吹き飛ばされてしまいます
column4:
A simple handful of courage can be blown away by
a single roar from the Evil Dragon.

column3: 多くの民は――強くはありません
column4: Many of the people... They are not strong.

column3: わたしはかつてメイロワ将軍の腹心の部下でした
column4:
I used to be General Meirova's trusted
subordinate.

column3:
これだけは覚えておいてください
将軍は、悪い人ではありません
column4:
Please remember this: The general is not a bad
person.

column3: ジリアンはどうですか？
column4: What about Gillian?

column3:
メイロワ将軍に振り回されているのであれば
何か助言ができるかもしれない
わたしのところに来るように伝えてください
column4:
If you are being pushed around by General Meirova,
there may be some advice I can give you.
Please let them know to come to me.

column3:
わたしの希望はね――
次の火竜を見たいということです
column4: My hope is— to see the next fire dragon!

column3: アッカーシェランとともに生きる、真っ当な火竜を
column4:
Acre Selund, a dignified Fire Dragon, living
alongside.

column3: 戦乱の世は嫌というほど見てきました
column4: I've seen enough of warfare.

column3:
流される血、消えない苦鳴――そうして手に入れた
安定、平和、繁栄を、よそから来た竜に乱され
黙っているわけにはいきません
column4:
The blood that is spilled, the bitter cry that
will not go away - that's how we got stability,
peace, and prosperity, and we can't just sit back
and let a dragon from another land disrupt it!

column3:
わたしが何かに反対したら、そこには何か
理由があると思っていただきたい
column4:
If I oppose something, I would like you to think
that there is a reason behind it.

column3:
メイロワ将軍は、反発心だのなんだの
感情のせいにしがちですからね
column4:
General Meirova tends to attribute things to
resentment and emotions, you know.

column3: ふーむ、何用でしょうか？
column4: Hmm, what can I help you with?

column3: おやおや、王子探しは中断ですか？
column4: Oh my, is the search for the prince on hold?

column3: そちらの首尾はいかがです？
column4: How about the progress over there?

column3:
王子は心身ともにご無事であったと
聞いています
column4:
I hear that the Prince is safe, both physically
and mentally.

column3: 良かった――本当に良かった
column4: Good--really good.

column3:
ネド王子はご無事――
しかも覚者であると聞いていますが
なにぶん、疑い深い性格でしてね
column4:
Prince Nedo is safe—
and moreover, I hear he is an Arisen.
However, he has a suspicious personality.

column3:
この地の守備固めの算段を終えたら
わたしも王子の下へ馳せ参じましょう
column4:
After finishing the defense of this area, I will
also hurry to the prince's side.

column3:
敵の攻勢に対処しつつ“悪しき竜”を
倒す方法も模索しなくてはなりません
column4:
While the focus tends to be only on the infected
monsters, the condition of plants and soil is also
dire.

column3:
こう見えてわたしも武闘派
弱腰になる心配など無用ですよ
column4:
Even though it may not look like it, I am also a
martial artist. There is no need to worry about me
being wishy-washy.

column3:
こちらは問題ありませんよ
ネド王子のお側に仕えてください
column4:
There is no problem here. Please serve Prince
Nedo.

column3:
こちらは問題ありませんよ
ネド王子のお側に仕えてください
column4:
There is no problem here, please serve Prince
Nedo.

column3:
敵は我々が目一杯引きつけますから
ええ、派手にやりますとも
column4:
The enemy will be completely occupied with us.
Yes, we will be very flashy!

column3:
今は兵達を労い、休ませる時です
今少し、時間をください
column4:
Now is the time to commend and give rest to the
soldiers. Please wait a little while.

column3:
漆黒の鎧をまとった騎士のうわさは
聞きましたかな？
column4:
Have you heard the rumors about the knight
wearing jet-black armor?

column3:
その者が現れたことで王都は陥落したとか
いや、それ以上のことは知らないのですが
column4:
The Royal Capital fell because of the appearance
of that person, or so I've heard. Well, I don't
know anything beyond that.

column3:
出撃の準備は整っています
しかし、まだ命令が届きませんのでね
column4:
Preparations for deployment are complete.
However, we have yet to receive orders.

column3:
大戦にも関わらず声が掛からなかったのは
我々は第二の矢として待機せよということ
column4:
Despite the war, the reason why our voices were
not heard is because we were told to wait as the
second arrow.

column3: その時までここで矢尻を研いでおきましょう
column4: Until then, let's sharpen our arrowheads here.

column3: 王都の攻略は失敗に終わったそうですね
column4:
It seems that the capture of the royal capital
ended in failure.

column3:
わたしたちはここで散った者たちの
安息を祈っています
column4: We pray for the repose of those who perished here.

column3:
立ち寄ってくれたことはうれしいのですが
ネド王子とメイロワ将軍のそばに
いてあげてくれると安心なのですがね
column4:
I am glad that you stopped by, but it would be
reassuring if you could stay by the side of Prince
Nedo and General Meirova.

column3:
あなたたちがここにいるということは
向こうは一件落着でしょうか？
column4:
If you guys are here, does that mean it's all
settled on the other side?

column3: いいえ、そうは見えませんね――
column4: No, it doesn't look like—

column3:
そろそろ我々も出陣しましょうかな
たとえ命令がなくても行くつもりですよ
column4:
I think it's time for us to head out.
We're going even if we don't get the orders to go.

column3:
王子の失踪は、ただの家出騒動では
ありません
column4:
The disappearance of the prince is not a simple
case of running away from home.

column3:
王子はアッカーシェランの未来そのもの
なのですからね
column4:
The prince is the future of Acre Selund, after
all.

column3:
王子がお立場を棄てることは考えられない
わたしはただただ王子を信じるのみです
column4:
It is inconceivable that the prince would abandon
his position. I only believe in him!

column3:
ジッとしてなどいられませんね
わたしも最前線に立たせてもらいますよ
column4:
I can't just stand still,
I'll stand on the front line too.

column3:
準備が整い次第、王子のところへ
馳せ参じるつもりです
column4:
As soon as preparations are complete, I plan to
hasten to the prince's side.

column3:
皆さんお疲れさまでした
残りの人生を平穏に送れるように
わたしは日々祈るつもりです
column4:
Thank you all for your hard work. I will pray
every day that you have peace for the rest of your
lives.

column3:
皆さんのぶんも――いやいや、それは
余計なお世話ですかな
column4:
Everyone's share―― No, no, is that really any of
your business?

column3:
声がでかくてうるさかったり、反対に、小さくて
聞こえない時はそう言っておくれ
column4:
When my voice is loud and annoying, or on the
contrary, when it's so quiet that you can't hear,
let me know.

column3:
こればっかりは習い性でね
盗賊は、ほら、いろんな状況で仕事をするからさ
column4:
It's all a habit.
Thieves, you see, work in all kinds of situations.

column3:
あたしの名前は誰でも知ってるけど、顔を知っている
人間はそういないよ
column4:
Everyone knows my name, but not everyone knows my
face.

column3:
できればずっとそのままが良かったけど
まあ、そうも言ってられないね
column4:
If possible, I would have preferred to stay as it
was, but well, I can't just keep saying that.

column3:
あたしが投獄されたのは息子の意見を
無視したからなんだ
牢屋の中で、ずいぶん反省したよ
column4:
I was imprisoned because I ignored my son's
opinion.
I felt so much remorse while I was in jail.

column3: それで今の、聞き分けのいいあたしがいるのさ
column4: That's why I'm such a good listener now.

column3: 婆さんだと思ってなめるんじゃないよ？
column4: Don't think I'm just an old lady.

column3:
そのへんの爺さんなら５人でかかってきても
目じゃないさ
column4:
Any old man out there, five of them could come at
you and you wouldn't bat an eye.

column3: あたしは権威ってのが大キライでね
column4: I hate authority

column3:
でも、気づいたら
あたしが盗賊界の権威みたいなものさ
ああ、たまらないよ
column4:
But then I realized, I'm like the authority in
the bandit world.
Oh, I can't wait!

column3:
だから、竜と王族には強くあってもらわないと
困るんだ
column4:
So, we need the dragons and royalty to stay
strong.

column3:
これを聞いたからってどうするわけでもないけど
レスタニアにもお宝はあるんだろう？
column4:
Not that I'm going to do anything about this, but
you do have treasures in Lestania, don't you?

column3:
大方、ゴブリンあたりが
ため込んでいるんじゃないかい？
column4: Most likely, the goblins are hoarding them.

column3: 長く生きると、想像もしなかったことが起こるよ
column4: If you live long enough, unexpected things happen.

column3:
悪しき竜のことはそりゃあ一大事だけど
あたしがメイロワと手を組むなんてねえ
column4:
The whole Evil Dragon thing is a big deal, but I
can't believe I'm working with Meirova.

column3:
あんたたちの装備には見たことのない材料が
使われているね――
落ち着いたら、ぜひ、レスタニアへ行ってみたいね
column4:
I've never seen these materials used in your
equipment--
I'd love to visit Lestania when you get settled!

column3:
言っておくけどね
あたしが盗むのは王家のお宝だけさ
column4: Just so you know I only steal royal treasures.

column3:
でも義賊というわけじゃない
施しは好きじゃないからね
column4:
But that doesn't mean I'm a righteous bandit.
I don't like charity.

column3: あたしの息子たちもどこかで戦っているんだろうね
column4: I'm sure my sons are fighting somewhere too.

column3:
まあ、無事でいてくれればそれでいいんだ
生きていれば、また盗賊稼業を楽しめるさ
column4:
Well, just stay safe and that's all that matters.
As long as you're alive, you can enjoy being a
bandit again.

column3: うん、あたしかい？
column4: Yeah, what about me?

column3:
別にあたしを助けに来たわけじゃ
ないだろう？
column4: You didn't come here to help me, did you?

column3:
ああ、構いやしないよ
で、メイロワ将軍はなんだって？
column4: Ah, I don't mind. So, what about General Meirova?

column3:
あの爺さんが頭を下げれば
解放軍に協力しないことはない
伝えといてくれ
column4:
If that old man bows his head, there's nothing he
won't do to help the Liberation Army. Please relay
this.

column3:
ネド王子、気張りすぎじゃないのかい？
ありゃ、大丈夫かね
column4:
Prince Nedo, aren't you trying too hard? Oh dear,
are you okay?

column3:
とにかくね、敵にここまで来られたら
どうしようもないよ
column4:
Anyway, if the enemy manages to come this far,
there's nothing we can do.

column3: それを忘れずに戦っておくれ
column4: Remember that and keep fighting.

column3:
“悪しき竜”と対峙したことで王子はどうやら
気持ちが大きくなっているようだ
column4:
It seems that the prince is feeling better after
confronting the "evil dragon."

column3: これは危険な兆候だよ
column4: This is a dangerous sign.

column3: 入り口だ通路だと王家は隠し事が多いね
column4:
Entrances, corridors, the royal family has a lot
to hide.

column3:
それを暴くのがわたしたちの
楽しみなんだけどさ
column4: That's what we're looking forward to uncovering.

column3: 入り口だ通路だと王家は隠し事が多いね
column4:
Entrances, corridors, the royal family has a lot
to hide.

column3:
それを暴くのがわたしたちの
楽しみなんだけどさ
column4:
That's what we're looking forward to
uncovering.

column3:
城に忍び込むなんてのは何度もしたけど
斬り込んで行くなんて初めてだ
column4:
I've snuck into the castle many times before, but
this is my first time sneaking in and attacking.

column3: 正直に言って――胸がおどるよ
column4: To be honest... my heart is pounding.

column3:
奪われたものは、ひとつひとつ
取り戻せばいいのさ
column4:
What was taken from us, one by one, we'll get
back.

column3: 盗賊のあたしが言うことじゃないがね
column4:
As a bandit, it's not my place to say, but you
know.

column3:
メガドは王都だからね
それはそれは豊かな町だったよ
盗賊の修行の場さ
column4:
Because Megado is the Royal Capital, it was a
very prosperous city. This is the training ground
for thieves.

column3: 厄介なことになりそうだねえ
column4: Sounds like it's going to be tricky.

column3: 北の盗賊たちと一緒にあたしも行くよ
column4: I'll go with the thieves from the north.

column3:
どうしたんだい
顔色が冴えないね
column4: What's wrong? You look pale.

column3:
ああ戻ったんだね
やっぱりあんたたちがいてくれないと
背中が不安だよ
column4:
Oh you're back. I still need you guys. I'm
worried about my back.

column3:
解放軍は再編成中さ
でもね、どんなに頑張ったって
あんたたちのいない穴は埋まらない
column4:
The Liberation Army is regrouping but you know,
no matter how hard we try we can't fill the hole
without you guys.

column3:
そっちにも事情はあるだろうけど
最後まで付き合ってもらうよ
column4:
You may have your own circumstances, but please
stay with me until the end.

column3:
あとは“悪しき竜”だね
ちょっと遠回りしちまったけど
一歩一歩、追い詰めているはずだよ
column4:
The Evil Dragon is the only thing remaining.
Although we took a little detour; Step by step, we
should be cornering it.

column3:
初めて会った頃に比べたら王子は
成長した――そう思った矢先のこれだよ
column4:
Compared to when we first met, the prince has
grown— that's what I thought, and just as I did,
this happened.

column3:
こんな行動をするなんて
まだまだ子供だってことなんだろうね
column4:
Don't act like this. It shows that you're still a
child.

column3:
初めて会った頃に比べたら王子は
成長した――そう思った矢先のこれだよ
column4:
Compared to when we first met, the prince has
grown— that's what I thought, and just as I did,
this happened.

column3:
こんな行動をするなんて
まだまだ子供だってことなんだろうね
column4:
Don't act like this. It shows that you're still a
child.

column3: 孫たちが世話になったね
column4: Thanks for taking care of the grandchildren.

column3:
おっと――
こんな月並みな礼をしちまうとは
あたしも歳を取ったねえ
column4:
Oops-- I can't believe I'm resorting to such a
clichéd gesture. I guess I'm getting old.

column3:
王子の不在が噂になり始めたよ
あんたらの耳にも入ると思うけど
放っておきな
column4:
The absence of the prince has started to become a
rumor, you know. But just leave it alone.

column3: あたしがなんとかするからさ
column4: I'll take care of it.

column3:
人生ってのはほんと気紛れだね
何が起こるかわからない
column4:
Life is really unpredictable.
You never know what will happen.

column3:
ああ、この歳になっても
驚くようなことはまだまだいっぱい起こるよ
column4:
Oh, even at this age, there are still many
surprising things happening.

column3:
城内は静かなものさ
みんな自分を見つめ直しているんだろうね
column4:
The inside of the castle is quiet.
Everyone is reflecting on themselves.

column3:
王子は重要人物には違いないけど
主人公は解放軍のひとりひとりだ
王子のことばかり思っちゃいられないさ
column4:
The prince must be an important person, but the
hero is one of the liberation army too. You can't
think only about the prince.

column3:
フィンダムの竜に起こったことを
小耳に挟んだよ
column4:
I heard a rumor about what happened to Phindym's
dragon.

column3:
フィンダムへ行って、話を聞いた方が
良さそうだね
column4:
Sounds like it would be better to go to Phindym
and talk to them.

column3:
雑談は苦手でな
――悪いな
column4: I'm not good at chit chat. -- sorry.

column3:
言わなかったかな――
わたしは楽しい雑談相手ではない
column4:
Did I not say it? - I'm not a fun person to chat
with.

column3: 人からは見下されるくらいが丁度良い――
column4:
Being looked down upon by others is just about
right.

column3:
わたしなりの哲学だが、理解者は少ない
おまえはどうだ？
column4:
My own philosophy, but few people understand it.
What about you?

column3:
わたしの両親は性格が昼と夜――空と海ほどに
性格が違う人たちだった
column4:
My parents were people whose personalities were
as different as night and day— as different as the
sky and the sea.

column3:
わたしは母とうまが合ったが
はて昼だろうか夜だろうかと時々思うのだ
column4:
I get along with my mother but sometimes I wonder
if we're just day and night.

column3:
苦難が我々を結びつけたことは否定しない
苦難が我々を強くしたことも否定はできない
column4:
I do not deny that suffering has brought us
together. I cannot deny that suffering has made us
stronger.

column3:
しかし――この状況に意味があるとすれば
それくらいだと思わないか？
column4:
However, if there is any meaning to this
situation, wouldn't it be something like that?

column3: ああ、用件を聞こうか
column4: Let's hear what you have to say.

column3:
用がすんだら国へ帰れ
今の我々には監視すら負担になる
column4:
When you finish your task, you can go back to
your country. It's too much work for us now to
even keep an eye on you.

column3:
風が吹いてきた――
これは追い風だ――ああ、感じるぞ
column4:
The words of Master White Dragon—I cannot let
even a single word pass me by.

column3:
将軍が戻ってから流れが変わったな
そういう人なんだよ、あの人は
column4:
The flow has changed since the general returned.
That's the kind of person he is.

column3:
ジリアンはうまく立ち回っているだろうか
交渉上手というわけではないからな――
column4:
I wonder if Gillian is standing up to it well.
She's not exactly a great negotiator.

column3:
王子が盗賊の世話になるとはね
将軍も心中穏やかではないだろうな
column4:
I can't believe the prince is in the care of
bandits. I'm sure the general is not at peace with
that.

column3:
盗賊たちの受け入れ準備をした方が
よいのだろうか――
column4: Should we prepare to receive the bandits?

column3: どうだ？　少しは陣が明るくなったか？
column4:
Well? Has the situation in the camp improved a
bit?

column3:
ネド王子は、自分の身は自分で守ると
頑なだがそうはいかない
column4:
Prince Nedo said he would protect himself.
He's stubborn, but it doesn't work that way.

column3: あんたたちも力を貸してくれ
column4: Please lend me your strength as well

column3:
このティネスの守りを固めるべきか
それとも強固な砦を求めて
遠征すべきか――
column4:
Should we fortify the defenses of Fort Thines, or
should we go on an expedition searching for a
stronger fortress-?

column3: ふむ、将軍と相談してみようか
column4: Hmm, let's consult with the general.

column3: しばらく兵の増強は難しいだろう
column4:
It will be difficult to reinforce the troops for
a while.

column3:
となれば、今いる兵たちの配備を
工夫して難局を乗り切らなければな
column4:
Then, we'll have to get through the harsh
situation by devising a way to deploy the troops
we have now.

column3: １人、３人と兵が増えていく
column4:
The number of soldiers is increasing, one by one,
and three by three.

column3:
日々、少しずつではあるがネド王子を慕って
民たちが集まってくるんだ
column4:
Every day, little by little, the people gather
around Prince Nedo.

column3:
イェルハルドがいるから抜かりはないと
思うが陽動部隊の連中はちゃんと食事を
とっているだろうか
column4:
I'm sure Gerhard is there to make sure that
everything is taken care of, but I wonder if those
guys in the diversionary unit are getting a proper
meal.

column3:
イェルハルドがいるから抜かりはないと
思うが陽動部隊の連中はちゃんと食事を
とっているだろうか
column4:
I'm sure Gerhard is there to make sure that
everything is taken care of, but I wonder if those
guys in the diversionary unit are getting a proper
meal.

column3:
展望城は王家だけではなく
我々解放軍の面々にとっても思い入れのある
場所だ
column4:
The Lookout Castle is not only a place that is
dear to the royal family, but also to all of us in
the Liberation Army.

column3: わたしは参加できないが――頼むぞ
column4: I can't participate, but I'm counting on you.

column3:
わたしも城へ行きたいが
砦の差配も重要な任務だからな
column4:
I'd like to go to the castle, too, but
it's an important mission to man the fort.

column3:
王都メガドの奪回は簡単ではないだろう
でも、今の解放軍ならやれる気がする
column4:
It won't be easy to reclaim the Royal Capital of
Megado, but I feel like the Liberation Army can do
it now.

column3:
そっちの様子はどうだい？
ここの留守はまかせてくれよ
column4:
How's it going over there?
I'll take care of things here myself.

column3:
最前線へ飛んで行きたいが
砦を空にするわけにはいかないのだ
王子と解放軍を頼んだぞ
column4:
I'd love to rush to the front lines, but we can't
leave the fort empty.
Take care of the prince and the liberation army.

column3: 第一次王都奪回作戦は失敗したと聞く
column4:
I heard that the first attempt to retake the
Royal Capital has failed.

column3:
次の作戦には参加したいが持ち場を
離れるわけにはいかないからな
column4:
I want to participate in the next mission, but I
can't leave my post.

column3: 顔を見に来てくれたのか？
column4: Did you come to see me?

column3:
うれしいね
みんなにも声をかけてやってくれ
column4:
That's great. Please speak to everyone and let
them know.

column3:
今はメガド奪回作戦の重要な局面のはず
さあ早く戻ってくれ
column4:
Now is an important moment in the plan to regain
Megado. Please come back quickly.

column3:
展望城に移らなくても良いのだろうか
わたしが必要ではないのだろうか
column4:
Is it okay not to move to Lookout Castle? Am I
not needed?

column3:
わたしの知る限り、ここには
ネド王子は来ていない
column4: As far as I know, Prince Nedo is not here.

column3: ここだけの話――
column4: Just between you and me...

column3:
周囲のおとなたちがネド王子を
甘やかしすぎたということはないだろうか
いや、ここだけの話だ
column4:
Could it be that the adults around have spoiled
Prince Nedo too much? No, this is just between us.

column3:
いろいろな噂が聞こえてくるが
なに、心配はしていないさ
column4: I hear a lot of rumors, but I'm not worried.

column3: 皆、やる時はやる人たちだからな
column4:
Everyone, because they are the people who do it
when they need to, right.

column3:
君たちと出会った頃、わたしたちの心は
暗い海のようだったが――今はどうだ
column4:
When we met you, our hearts were like dark
seas--but now?

column3:
たとえ危機的な状況でも
明日を信じることができるよ
column4:
Even in times of crisis, you can have faith in
tomorrow!

column3:
この砦の強化案を考えているんだ
悪しき竜はいなくなってもオークどもは
相変わらずだからね
column4:
I am considering a plan to strengthen this
fortress. Even though the evil dragon is gone, the
orcs are still here.

column3: やあ
column4: Hey

column3: 良い天気だね
column4: Good weather, isn't it?

column3: 調子はどうだ？
column4: How's it going?

column3:
腕が立つようだから
また何か依頼するかもしれない
column4:
You seem to have a good arm, so I may request
something else from you.

column3:
私はリズ様のポーン
あの方は、私がお守りしなければ――
column4: I am Lady Lise's Pawn. If I don't protect her-

column3:
リズ様、もう少し
そそっかしさをあらためて下されば――
column4:
Lady Lise, if you could please be a little more
attentive—

column3:
覚者さま、恐れながら
リズ様のお手伝いをお頼みします
column4: Ser Arisen, I'm afraid I need Lady Lise's help...

column3: おう、そっちはどうだ？　その後
column4:
Hey, how's it going over there? What's been
happening since then?

column3:
魔物を倒すだけが覚者の仕事じゃあねぇ
あぁ、お前もそのうち分かるぜ
column4:
Being able to defeat demons is not the only job
of an Arisen, you know. Oh, you'll understand that
soon.

column3:
言い訳はなしだ、そんなもん考える前に
手と足を動かせよ
column4:
No excuses, move your hands and feet before
thinking about that.

column3:
よう、ちょっとした賭けを――
いや、やめとくわ
column4:
Hey, want to make a little bet?
Nah, forget it.

column3:
金をためてキノザの原泉近くに屋敷を建てるのよ
それが俺の目下の夢だ
column4:
I'll save my money and build a mansion near
Kinoza's spring. That's my current dream.

column3: ばかっ強い魔物と真っ向勝負して連戦連勝
column4:
A series of head-to-head battles with the
strongest demons and a series of victories.

column3:
覚者になった頃はそれでおもしろおかしく
暮らしていけたが、もう、飽きちまった
――これから、どうするよ
column4:
When I became an Arisen, I could live with that
and have fun. But, I've grown tired now. What do I
do from now on?

column3:
刺激だぜ、刺激
俺が欲しいのはそれだ――やっとわかった
column4:
It's exciting, so exciting. That's what I want――
I finally understand.

column3:
俺はずっとはぐれ覚者のつもりでいたけどよ――
やっぱ、どっかで繋がってんだよな――ケッ！
column4:
I've always thought of myself as a lost Arisen,
but in the end, I guess there's some connection
somewhere. Damn it!

column3: 柄にもねえこと言っちまったぜ
column4: I said something I shouldn't have.

column3:
まあ、ボチボチやろうぜ
急ぐことはねえさ
column4: Well, let's take it easy. There's no rush.

column3:
あんたの言うことにはなんだって従うつもりで
いるから賭け事禁止だけは言ってくれるなよ
column4:
I intend to obey whatever you say, but don't tell
me to stop gambling.

column3: 俺をウソつきにしたくなかったらよ
column4: If you don't want to make a liar out of me

column3: 神殿にいる時くらい、いろんな奴と話しておけよ
column4:
You should at least talk to a lot of people when
you're in the temple.

column3:
俺の見たところ、あんたに話しかけられると
どいつもこいつもうれしそうな顔になる
さぞ名誉なことに違いねえ
column4:
From what I've seen, when you talk to them,
everyone gets happy and they all have a delighted
expression on their faces.

column3:
ジョゼフのジジイは世の中がざわついている時の方が
いきいきして見えねえか？
column4:
Doesn't Joseph's old man look more alive when the
world is in turmoil?

column3: 魔物の一種かもしれねえぞ
column4: It might be a type of monster.

column3:
はぁ――金がねえ――
負けた――
column4:
Huh... no money...
I'm screwed.

column3: あ？　なんだよ
column4: Huh? What's up?

column3:
しかし――
なんだって俺が――
column4:
But--
what the hell am I--

column3:
俺も覚者の端くれだが
この場所は息が詰まるぜ
column4:
I'm a bit of an Arisen man myself, but this place
is suffocating.

column3:
言うまでもねえが、俺は単純にガシガシと
戦うのが好きだ
column4:
There's no need to say it, but I simply love a
grueling fight.

column3:
勝敗に金がかかってるのなんて最高だぜ
そんなわけだから、おまえ――
そういう場に、さっさと俺を行かせろよ
column4:
There's nothing like winning and losing with
money on the line.
That's why you--
You better get me to that kind of place, and get
on with it.

column3:
侵食魔退治は俺に任せろ
ガシガシやっつけておくぜ
column4:
Leave the eradication of the Corruption to me.
I'll take care of it, no problem.

column3: 俺はやっぱり戦場の男――
column4: I am a man of the battlefield.

column3:
そう思ってきたが、こう無尽蔵にわくような
侵食魔と戦っていると心の奥底が
凍りつきそうになるぜ
永遠に続くのかよってな
column4:
I have come to think so, but deep down in my
heart, when I fight against the seemingly endless
invading corruption, it feels as if my soul is
about to freeze. Is this going to last forever?

column3:
黒騎士を倒せば何もかも終わりじゃねえのかよ
あとはオマケみたいなものだろ？
column4:
I thought defeating the Black Knight was the end
of everything. The rest is kind of a bonus, right?

column3:
島に出たみたいな奴がこれからの相手だとしたら
こっちもよっぽどの精鋭を揃えないと
やられちまうぜ
column4:
If the guy who showed up on the island is our
opponent from now on, we have to gather quite an
elite team or we'll be done for.

column3: レオの野郎――放って置いていいのか？
column4:
That bastard Leo, can we afford to leave him
alone?

column3:
口ではなんと言おうと
奴はここでの立場――責任を捨てた男だ
このままじゃあ、スカッとしねえぞ
column4:
No matter what he says, he's a man who has
abandoned his position and responsibility here. If
things continue like this, it won't be satisfying
in the least.

column3:
さあどうするよ
ここでジッとしてるのが仕事か？
column4:
What are we going to do? Is our job just to sit
here and do nothing?

column3:
セシリーが神殿に匿われていること――
黒騎士は知ってると思うか？
column4:
Do you think the Black Knight knows that Cecily
is being hidden in the temple?

column3:
俺と話したって状況は何も変わらない
んなことは、わかってんだろう？
column4:
Talking to me won't change anything about the
situation. You understand that, right?

column3:
侵食魔なんてのはいい加減おさらばしてえよな？
もちろん、黒騎士野郎もな
column4:
Don't you think it's about time to say goodbye to
the infected monsters? And the black knight too,
of course.

column3:
レオはよ――バカだよな
冷めた顔して、熱くなりすぎるんだ
あいつは昔からそうだったぜ
column4:
Leo is such an idiot, isn't he? He always looks
calm, but he gets too heated. He has been like
that since forever.

column3: 俺はもっと賑やかなところが好きだぜ
column4: I like it when it's more lively.

column3:
人でも魔物でも構わねえ
その気になりゃいつでも大騒ぎできる程度に
相手がいるのがいいんだ
column4:
It doesn't matter if they're human or monsters.
It's good to have someone to make a big fuss with,
whenever we feel like it.

column3:
ここの連中の頭の固さはジョゼフ以上だが
悪い気はしねえな
連中なりに筋が通っている
column4:
The stubbornness of these people here is greater
than Joseph's, but I don't feel bad about it. They
have their own way of doing things.

column3:
――いや、ジョゼフのことをどうこう言ってる
わけじゃねえぞ
column4: -- No, I'm not talking about Joseph.

column3:
聞いたところによると《原始の雫》は
そう簡単に手に入るシロモノじゃねえようだ
column4:
According to what I heard, it seems that
《Primeval Drops》is not something that can easily
be obtained.

column3:
となると、相当な手練れじゃないと
無事の帰還は難しいと思うぜ
column4:
Then you'd have to be a pretty good hand to
make a safe return, I'd think.

column3:
俺たちがもう少し早くこのフィンダムに
来ていればな――
そりゃいいっこ無しってか？
column4:
If only we'd come to Phindym a little earlier--
No more of that, huh?

column3:
やっぱり俺はレスタニアの男だ
空気が鼻をスースー通ってくぜ
column4:
I'm a Lestanian man after all.
The air feels sooooooo good coming through my
nose!

column3:
寝ても覚めても侵食魔退治よ
身体はキツいが気が楽っちゃあ楽だな
column4:
Arisen, whether sleeping or awake, it's all about
fighting the Infected. My body is tired, but my
mind is at ease.

column3:
しっかし、魔物ってのは尽きないよな
こいつらいったい何のためにいるんだとか
テツガク的なことも考えたくなるぜ
column4:
Nevertheless, enemies never seem to run out, you
know? I wonder what they're actually here for. It
makes me want to think about it from a
philosophical perspective.

column3:
これで何もかも、トントン拍子に上手くいけば
いいんだがな
column4:
If everything goes smoothly as planned, it would
be good.

column3:
敵ってのは、敵らしくあって欲しいぜ
憎らしくて、悪くてよ
column4: Enemies should be like enemies. Hateful and evil.

column3:
もう少しここにいるぜ
行く末を見届けたくてよ
column4:
I'll be here a little longer just to see where it
all goes.

column3:
また留守がちになると思って
部屋を引き払ったぜ
しばらくは宿暮らしだ
column4:
I thought I would be gone frequently, so I left
my room. I will be living in temporary
accommodations for a while.

column3:
絶望の大陸アッカーシェランか
でもよ、あのジリアンの目には
光があったよな
column4:
Is it the Land of Despair, Acre Selund? But you
know, in Gillian's eyes, there was light, wasn't
there?

column3:
王子は１２歳とか言ってたな
自分の頭で考えて行動できる年頃だ
column4:
The prince said he was 12 years old; he should be
old enough to think and act for himself.

column3:
つまりジッとしてるわけじゃねえ
厄介っちゃあ厄介だな
column4:
So, it's not like I'm just sitting still. It's
troublesome, that's for sure.

column3:
王子と一緒にいる盗賊ってのは
どんな連中だろうな
column4: I wonder what kind of bandits are with the prince.

column3:
義賊みたいなやつらかそれとも
ただの山賊集団か――
column4:
Those guys are like noble thieves, or maybe just
a group of bandits—

column3:
敵は“悪しき竜”だろ？
盗賊と王家の家臣が揉めている場合じゃねえ
――って言ってこいよ
column4:
The enemy is an "Evil Dragon", right?
This is not the time for a fight between a bandit
and a royal vassal.

column3:
俺はオークだのなんだのを引き受けるから
王子は頼むぜ
column4:
I'll take care of the orcs and whatnot.
You take care of the prince.

column3:
緩んでる場合じゃねえと思うけどよ
まあ、それは将軍たちが決めることだな
column4:
I don't think it's the time to slack off, but
well, that's something the generals decide.

column3:
覚者になってからこっちずっとオークと
戦って鼻がバカになっちまったが
column4:
Since I became an Arisen, I've been fighting Orcs
all this time and now I'm getting all sniffly.

column3:
アッカーシェランのオークの匂いは
また独特――新鮮な気分で戦えるぜ
column4:
The scent of Acre Selund's Orcs is unique; it
makes you feel refreshed and ready to fight.

column3:
面倒な駆け引きはともかく
真っ向ぶつかり合いなら俺に任せろ
column4:
Ignoring the troublesome negotiations, Leave it
to me if it comes down to a direct confrontation.

column3:
“悪しき竜”の目的が自分の力を
誇示するためとは――
column4:
The purpose of the "Evil Dragon" is to
demonstrate their own power.

column3: そりゃガキ大将の理屈じゃねえか
column4: That's a kid's theory, isn't it?

column3:
展望城のオークの数も見えてきたな
しかも少しずつだが、減っていやがる
column4:
I'm seeing the number of orcs in Lookout Castle
And they're getting fewer, little by little.

column3: ジリアンたち、いい仕事してるぜ
column4:
Gillian and the others are doing a great job, you
know.

column3:
展望城のオークの数も見えてきたな
しかも少しずつだが、減っていやがる
column4:
I'm seeing the number of orcs in Lookout Castle
And they're getting fewer, little by little.

column3: ジリアンたち、いい仕事してるぜ
column4:
Gillian and the others are doing a great job, you
know.

column3: 血がよ、ザワザワと沸くようだぜ
column4: My blood is boiling, man.

column3:
メイロワ将軍のことだから次から次へと
作戦をぶち上げそうだな
column4:
I'm sure General Meirova will be blasting out one
operation after another.

column3: 少し休ませろって話だ
column4: Time for a rest.

column3:
チッ――何をしていても
真っ黒野郎のことを考えちまうぜ
column4:
Damn--no matter what I do, I'm always thinking
about that pitch black bastard.

column3:
くそ――あれこれ雑念が多いな
このままじゃ目の前の敵に
集中できねえぞ
column4:
Damn--there's a lot of distractions.
I can't focus on the enemy in front of me if I
keep going like this.

column3: 身体の調子はどうだ？
column4: How's your body feeling?

column3:
俺らにも影響が出ないとは限らねえ
今のうちにやれることやっておかねえと
column4:
We can't be sure it won't affect us too.
We should do what we can while we can.

column3:
気い抜くと――力も抜けるんだ
気張って行くぜ
column4:
When you let your mind wander... your strength
will wander, too. I'm going in strong.

column3:
足手まといにならねえように
せいぜい気ぃ張るぜ
column4: I'll do my best not to be a liability.

column3:
話しかけないでくれ
今の俺は憎悪の塊だぜ
column4:
Please don't talk to me.
I'm a bundle of hatred right now.

column3:
あれやこれや、賭けときゃ良かったぜ
大儲けできたろうによ
column4:
You should have bet on this, that, and the other
thing.
You could have made a fortune.

column3:
そんなにひとりが良いなら
ひとりにしてやれよ――ってわけには
いかねえかぁ
column4:
If you like to be alone so much, leave him alone.
I don't know.

column3:
これはなんとも歯がゆい状況だな
え？
column4: This is a very frustrating situation, isn't it?

column3:
心配事は性に合わねえ
俺は戦闘のあるところへ行かせて
もらうぜ
column4: Yeah, I'll listen if you want to talk.

column3:
まあ、こうなったら深いこと考えずに
ガスガスと前に進むしかねえよな
毎度のことだ
column4:
Well, in this situation, there's nothing else to
do but keep moving forward, with gusto. It's
always the same thing.

column3:
寝るぞ――俺は――ああ、なんなら
十日くらいぶっ通しで眠ってやる
column4:
I'm going to sleep ―― Oh, what the heck, I'll
sleep for about ten days straight.

column3: まだまだ、研究すべきことは多いな――
column4: There is still much to research,

column3:
各地では異変が今日も起こっている
その原因は必ずあるはずなのだ
column4:
Strange occurrences are happening everywhere
today. There must be a definite cause for it.

column3:
魔物の増加は白竜の衰えと
確実に関係している
竜とは、いったい世界にとって何者のか――
column4:
The increase of enemies is definitely related to
the decline of the White Dragon. What exactly is a
dragon to the world—?

column3:
なんだ
覚者と無駄話をする気は無い
用件を言ってくれ
column4:
What is it? I have no intention of talking to an
Arisen and wasting time on idle chatter. Just tell
me your business.

column3:
騎士団は団結を尊ぶ――
では、“騎士団の団結”とは具体的には何だと思う
column4:
The Order of the Knights values unity—So, what
exactly do you think "the unity of the Order of
the Knights" means?

column3:
自分は“ゲルト団長への忠誠心”が
それにあたると思っている
――覚者にこんな話をすべきではないな
column4:
I think "loyalty to Commander Gerd" is the
equivalent. --If so, then I shouldn't be speaking
to an Arisen.

column3:
無駄話をするつもりは無いと言っただろう
気持ちがたるんでいるんじゃないか
column4:
I said I didn't intend to chat. You don't think
your feelings have slackened, do you?

column3: 無駄話はいい、さっそく本題に入るぞ
column4: No time for idle chatter, let's get to the point.

column3:
――貴君は他のミッションの元に
パーティを組んでいるな
column4: You are part of a party for another mission.

column3:
先にそちらのミッションの参加予定を
取り消し、あらためてここに来てくれ
column4:
Please cancel your participation in the mission
over there first, and then come here again.

column3: 覚者、気を抜くなよ
column4: Arisen, don't let your guard down.

column3: 悪いが今は任務の途中だ
column4: Sorry, but I'm in the middle of a mission.

column3: こう魔物が増えてはたまらない
column4:
We can't afford for the monsters to increase like
this.

column3: いつこの戦いは終わるのだ
column4: When will this battle end?

column3: 魔物退治ばかりだな、まったく
column4: Enemy extermination is all there is, really.

column3: 神殿からの補給もあまりあてにできないぞ
column4:
We can't rely too much on supplies from the
temple.

column3: 今は話しかけないでくれ
column4: Please don't talk to me right now

column3: 白竜様のご加護を！
column4: The White Dragon's blessing!

column3: 任務に集中させてくれ
column4: Let me concentrate on the mission.

column3: ――くく、くくく――
column4: -- Mmm-hmm. - Mmm-hmm.

column3: ひ――なんだ、話掛けるな
column4: Oh... What? Don't talk to me.

column3:
ああ、そうだ、そうしよう――
それがいい――
column4: Ah, yes, let's do that―― That's good――
What?

column3: ――うぅ、今はやめて
column4: -- Uh-uh, not now.

column3: あっちへ、いっていて――
column4: Go over there――

column3: やあ、何かご用かな？
column4: Hello, do you need anything?

column3:
さぁて、そろそろ次の仕入れ支度を
考えないと
column4:
Well, I've got to start thinking about my next
stocking.

column3:
おっと、商品をみたいかい？
申し訳ない、今は準備しきれて
いないものも多くてね
column4:
Oh, do you want to see the goods? I'm sorry,
there are many things that haven't been fully
prepared yet.

column3: 覚者さま、ご機嫌いかがですか
column4: Master Arisen, how are you feeling today?

column3:
ああ、ちょっと待ってください
――はい、何か？
column4: Ah, please wait a little ―― Yes, what is it?

column3:
武器でも作れたら商売になるかもと
思うこともあるんですがね
column4:
I sometimes think that it might be good for
business if we could make some weapons.

column3: やあ、調子はどうだい
column4: Hey, how are you feeling?

column3: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげだよ
column4:
Today's existence is also thanks to The White
Dragon

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4:
These enemies are multiplying, it's really
overwhelming.

column3: ご機嫌いかが？
column4: How are you?

column3: 暮らしは厳しくなる一方だね
column4: Yes, life is becoming increasingly difficult.

column3: お仕事、頑張ってくださいな
column4: Please, do your best with your work.

column3:
おや、覚者さんかな
研究に付き合って貰って感謝しているよ
column4:
Oh, are you an Arisen? I'm grateful for your
assistance in my research.

column3:
異変はそこかしこで起こっている
私はそれを探求していてね
レスタニア中を巡っている
column4:
There are strange occurrences happening
everywhere I am investigating them, you know.
Traveling throughout Lestania.

column3: この辺りをもう少し調べていくか――
column4: Should I investigate this area a little further?

column3: やあ、調子はどうだい
column4: Hey, how are you doing?

column3: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげだよ
column4:
Today's existence is also thanks to The White
Dragon

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4:
These enemies are multiplying, it's really
overwhelming.

column3:
ああ、素晴らしきかな食事！
料理とはあらゆる素材と料理人の手が
織りなす究極のハーモニーなのだ！
column4:
Ah, a wonderful meal!
Cooking is the ultimate harmony of all
ingredients and the cook's hands!

column3:
珍しい食材について知っていたら
教えてくれたまえ
column4:
If you know anything about rare ingredients,
please tell me.

column3:
ふむ――意外とあの魔物の肉は
焼いたらいけるかもしれんな
column4:
Hmm... I wonder if that monster's meat could be
cooked.

column3: ヒヒヒヒ――ご機嫌いかが？
column4: Hehehe――How are you feeling today?

column3:
わたしはね、あれを探しているのさ
アレをね――
column4:
I am looking for it, you know. That thing, you
know.

column3: なんだい、何か用でもあるのかい？
column4: What's up? Do you need something?

column3: やあ、調子はどうだい
column4: Hey, how are you doing?

column3: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげだよ
column4:
Today's existence is also thanks to The White
Dragon

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4:
These enemies are multiplying, it's really
overwhelming.

column3:
やあ、君も探索かね？
この辺りはなかなか興味深いと思わないか
column4:
Hey, are you also exploring? Don't you find this
area quite interesting?

column3:
私は人を試すのが趣味でね――
いやいや、悪くとらないでくれたまえ
column4:
I enjoy testing people— No, no, no, don't take
this the wrong way.

column3:
単に人に興味があるだけだよ
ある者が何を目指し、何を思い、何を成すかね
column4:
I'm simply interested in people.
What some aspire to, what some think, what some
accomplish.

column3:
君は、なかなか腕に自信がありそうだ
――時に思うことはないかな？
column4:
You seem to have confidence in your skills. Do
you ever wonder about it?

column3: 己の力量は、真にどれほどのものか――とね
column4: How much are your abilities really worth?

column3: おお、私に何か用かね？
column4: Oh, do you need something from me?

column3: はぁい、何か用？
column4: Yes, can I help you?

column3:
わたしは各地を旅して回ってんの
まぁ、一応これでも
トレジャーハンターのはしくれよ
column4:
I am traveling around different places, Well, for
now, I guess you could say I'm a bit of a treasure
hunter.

column3: お宝情報があったら交換しましょ
column4:
If you have information on a treasure, let's
exchange it!

column3:
まだまだ行った事のない洞窟や遺跡は
たくさんあるのよね
column4:
There are still plenty of caves and ruins that I
have never been to, you know.

column3: 獲物になりそうなのは、あまりいないな
column4: Not a lot of potential prey out there.

column3: なんだ？　お前は何狙いだ？
column4: What? What are you aiming for?

column3: 厄介な魔物は遠くから狙うに限る
column4:
Troublesome enemies are best attacked from a
distance.

column3: フン、話しかけるな
column4: Hmph, don't talk to me.

column3: よそへ行け
column4: Go away

column3: 話すことなどない
column4: There is nothing to say anymore.

column3: あぁ、なんだてめぇ
column4: Ah, what the hell.

column3: やめろよ、今は話しかけるんじゃねぇよ
column4: Stop it, don't talk to me right now.

column3: ちっ、懐が厳しいぜ
column4: Well, my wallet is light.

column3: アァ――
column4: Ah――

column3: ウゥ――
column4: Ugh--

column3: カラダ――ガ――アァ――
column4: Body...ga...aah.

column3: ――ギギ
column4: -- Gigi.

column3: ウウウ――
column4: Uuu...

column3: 我々は、いつまで――
column4: How much longer will we...

column3: 帰りたい――
column4: I want to go home--

column3: どうして、こんな姿に――
column4:
Will Cecily be saved? There is no need to worry
because you guys are taking action. I keep telling
myself that, but...

column3:
ん――？
ああ、攻撃しないでくださいね
たたかう気はありませんので
column4:
Hm-?
Oh, please don't attack me.
I don't have any intention to fight.

column3:
――あら
魔物のわたしが話すのが珍しいですか？
column4:
Oh, do you find it unusual for a monster like me
to speak?

column3:
ハーピーは歌が命ですから声は出せるのですが
人間の言葉を覚えるかどうかは、それぞれですね
わたしはジンゲンに近い所で育ちましたから
column4:
I grew up near Jingen, so I know Harpies can
sing, so they can have a voice.
I'm not sure if they can learn human language or
not.

column3:
お腹――減ってきちゃった
あとで狩りにいかないと
column4: I'm getting hungry. I have to go hunting later.

column3: やあ、調子はどうだい
column4: Hey, how are you doing?

column3: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげだよ
column4:
Today's existence is also thanks to The White
Dragon

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4:
These enemies are multiplying, it's really
overwhelming.

column3: やあ、調子はどうだい
column4: Hey, how are you doing?

column3: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげだよ
column4:
Today's existence is also thanks to The White
Dragon

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4:
These enemies are multiplying, it's really
overwhelming.

column3: おお、調子はどうだ？
column4: Oh, how are you doing?

column3: 今日があるのも、白竜様あってこそだ
column4: Today exists because of The White Dragon exists.

column3: 任務ではよろしく頼む
column4: I kindly ask for your assistance with the task.

column3: お互い気が抜けんな
column4: Don't let your guard down.

column3: 気合を入れろよ
column4: Get pumped up!

column3: 魔物は増える一方だ
column4: The monsters keep increasing.

column3: やあ、そっちはどうだい
column4: Hey, how are you doing?

column3: 白竜さまのために、だな――
column4: For the sake of the White Dragon.

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4:
I can't stand it when these monsters increase
like this.

column3: まぁ、体には気をつけろよ
column4: Well, be careful with your body.

column3: いいな、気は抜くなよ
column4: That's nice, don't let your guard down.

column3: お前はポーン持ちなのか？　羨ましいよ
column4: Are you a pawn bearer? I'm envious.

column3: ふう、なかなか気が休まらないよ
column4: Phew, it's hard to relax.

column3: 任務は任務だからな
column4: It's a mission, after all.

column3: もっと鍛えないとな――
column4: I need to train more...

column3: ん、調子はどうだ？
column4: Hmm, how are you feeling?

column3: 白竜さまの加護を！
column4: Under the protection of The White Dragon!

column3: 物資補給も魔物討伐も終わりがみえんよ
column4:
Supplies replenishment and enemy extermination
have no end in sight.

column3: ご機嫌いかがかしら？
column4: How are you feeling?

column3: お互い、油断せずいきましょう
column4: Let's both be careful and not let our guard down.

column3:
覚者も騎士も、苦労は同じだと
思うのよね
column4:
Both the Arisen and the Knights face the same
hardships, I believe.

column3: あぁ、調子はどうだ？
column4: Yeah, how's it going?

column3: 魔物どもは増える一方だな
column4: The number of monsters is increasing.

column3: ん、何か用か？
column4: Hmm, what can I do for you?

column3: ――装備の点検はこまめにな
column4:
- The inspection of the equipment should be done
regularly.

column3: 準備はいつも整えておけよ
column4: Always be prepared.

column3: 道具類はまさかの時に必要だぞ
column4: Tools are necessary in case of emergencies.

column3: ふう、まったくお互い大変そうね
column4:
Phew, both of us seem to be going through a tough
time, don't we?

column3:
魔物に食われるくらいなら
逃げるよ、わたしは
column4: I'd rather run away than be eaten by demons.

column3: さぁ、次はどうしようか
column4: So, what should we do next?

column3: 調子はどうだ？
column4: How's it going?

column3:
装備はできるだけ軽くしておけよ
足の差はでかいぞ
column4:
Try to keep your equipment as light as possible.
The difference in mobility is significant.

column3:
大型魔物に登るときは、奴らの動きを
よく観察しろよ
column4:
When climbing on large monsters, observe their
movements well.

column3: うん、何？
column4: Yeah, what?

column3: ごめんね、今ちょっと話しかけないで
column4: I'm sorry, please don't talk to me right now

column3: 特に用はないんでしょ？
column4: You don't have any special purpose, right?

column3: ――ああ、なんだ？
column4: Oh, what is it?

column3: どうした、何か聞きたいのか？
column4: What's wrong, do you want to ask something?

column3: 敵はいつくるかわからんぞ
column4: You never know when the enemy will strike.

column3: ご機嫌いかが？
column4: How are you feeling?

column3: ここには何しにきたの？
column4: What did you come here for?

column3: さ、そろそろ別のところへいこうかな
column4: Well, it's time to go somewhere else.

column3: ふむ――なにかね？
column4: Hmm, what is it?

column3: 近頃はなかなか厄介な事件が増えてきたな
column4:
Lately, there have been quite a few troublesome
incidents.

column3: 魔物の活性を抑える術があればいいのだが
column4:
If there is a way to suppress the enemy's
activity, that would be great.

column3: あら、ご機嫌いかがですか？
column4: Oh, how are you feeling?

column3: 癒し手の需要は増える一方です
column4: The demand for healers continues to increase.

column3: あなたの旅によき導きがありますように
column4: May you have a good guidance on your journey

column3: あなたの旅によき導きがありますように
column4: May you have a good guidance on your journey

column3: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげでございます
column4:
Today's existence is also thanks to The White
Dragon

column3: 任務、ご苦労様です覚者様
column4: Thank you for your hard work, Arisen.

column3: あなたの旅によき導きがありますように
column4: May you have a good guidance on your journey

column3: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげですね
column4:
Today's existence is also thanks to The White
Dragon, isn't it

column3: お仕事頑張ってくださいませ、覚者さま
column4: Good luck with your work, Arisen

column3: よし、その調子で修練を重ねろよ！
column4: Okay, keep up the practice!

column3:
技は一日にしてならず！
ひとつひとつ身に付けていくんだ
column4:
Skill does not come in a day! You have to learn
each one step by step.

column3:
訓練にやりすぎはないぞ
じっくり実戦前に稽古していけ！
column4:
There's no such thing as too much training. Take
your time and practice before the actual battle!

column3: おう、訓練について質問か？
column4: Oh, do you have any questions about the training?

column3:
白竜に選ばれし覚者様――
古の武器についてであれば、お力になれるかと
column4:
Master Arisen, chosen by the White Dragon - If
it's about ancient weapons, I can be of
assistance.

column3:
人が武器を選ぶばかりではなく――
時として、武器が人を選ぶこともありましょう
column4:
It's not only humans who choose weapons -
Sometimes, weapons also choose their wielders.

column3: どうか貴方様も、それをお忘れなく
column4: Please do not forget that

column3:
武器とは、討つべきものの数だけ
それに相応しき“かたち”があるもの――
column4:
A weapon has as many forms as there are things to
kill.

column3:
竜の敵となりうるおそろしき魔を退けるには
手に持つ刃もまた、特別でなければなりません
column4:
To repel the fearsome demons that can become
enemies of the dragon, the blades we wield must
also be special.

column3:
遠き古より流れ伝わる智――
覚者の、そしてポーンの民の――
column4:
From ancient times, the wisdom that has been
passed down continues to flow— Of the Arisen, and
the people known as Pawns—

column3:
戦徒が、自ら主の剣となり鎧となるために
より良き剣や鎧を生まんとするは
必然ではないでしょうか――
column4:
Is it not necessary for a Myrmidion to seek
better weapons and armor, to become their own
Masters sword and shield?

column3: おう、調査の進捗はどうだ？
column4: Oh, how's the investigation going?

column3:
辺りをぐるっと歩いてみたが
この島の生態系はレスタニアとは
えらく違うようだな
column4:
I walked around the area and the ecosystem of
this island seems to be very different from
Lestania.

column3:
いつ、どんな魔物が飛び出してくるかわからんぞ
とっさの状況にも対処できるよう
装備や持ち物は常に見直しておけよ
調査探索の基本だ！
column4:
You never know when and what kind of creatures
will come at you. Always review your equipment and
items so you can handle any situation that arises.
It's the fundamentals of exploration and
investigation!

column3:
この魔赤島調査隊は精鋭揃いだ
難しい任務ではあるが、士気も高い
――俺か？　俺も久しぶりに勇み立ってるな！
column4:
This Bloodbane Isle expedition team is comprised
of elite members. Although it is a difficult
mission, their morale is high. ――As for me? I'm
also feeling a surge of courage after a long time!

column3:
前はグリッテン砦の防衛戦に参加していたんだが
モゴックの奴が墜ちてからは
いまいち張り合いが無くてな――
column4:
I used to be involved in the defense of Fort
Gritten, but since that Mogok guy went down, I
haven't had the same level of excitement--the
competition has really been lacking.

column3:
ここのエリアマスター就任の打診を受けた時は
これぞ、と思ったものだ！
column4:
When I received the offer to become an Area
Master here, I thought, "This is it!"

column3:
見ての通り、この駐屯地は臨時のものだ
だが、調査のために必要なものについては
それなりの質のものを集めている
column4:
As you can see, this base is temporary but we
have gathered the necessary equipment for the
investigation.

column3:
質だけじゃなく、数もきっちり揃えてあるぞ！
お前の部下たちにも遠慮なく使うよう
言っておいてくれ
column4:
Not only the quantity, but also the quality is
meticulous! Please tell your subordinates to use
it without hesitation.

column3:
おう、来たな！
あらためて自己紹介しておこうか
魔赤島調査隊、隊長のベルトランだ
この島のエリアマスターも兼任している
column4:
Oh, you've arrived! Let me introduce myself
again. I'm Bertrand, the captain of the Bloodbane
Isle research team. I'm also the Area Master of
this island.

column3:
エリアマスターとは言っても
こんな状況だ
まだ何一つわからんがな！
まずは拠点を一通り設営したところだ
column4:
Even though I say I'm an Area Master, the
situation is like this. I still don't understand
anything! First, I have to set up the base.

column3:
――そう不安そうな顔をするな！
島の全体像を早期に探るべく
身軽な人員を俺直属の斥候隊として
連れてきたから安心してくれ！
column4:
Don't look so worried! I've brought a team of
agile individuals as my direct reconnaissance unit
to swiftly explore the entire island. So, rest
assured!

column3:
彼らにはなるべく戦闘を避けさせ
島の地形や魔物の生息状況を
重点的に探らせていく予定だ
column4:
We'll have them avoid combat as much as possible,
and focus on exploring the island's terrain and
demonic inhabitants.

column3:
そして、斥候隊を始めとする
各部隊からの情報を統括したり
調査の方向性を監督するのが俺の仕事ってわけだ
column4:
And so, my job involves overseeing information
from various units, including the scout team, and
supervising the direction of the investigation.

column3:
監督といっても
お前たちはそれぞれの判断で
調査を進めてくれて構わん！
ジョゼフ様直々のお達しだ
column4:
Speaking of the overseer, each of you can proceed
with the investigation based on your own judgment!
This is a direct order from Joseph himself.

column3:
俺もこの拠点で大人しくしているつもりは無いぞ！
この未知の状況、己の実力を計るには
絶好のチャンスだ！　腕が鳴るな！
column4:
I don't intend to sit still at this base either!
In this unknown situation, it's the perfect
opportunity to test my abilities. I'm itching to
go!

column3:
調査の進捗はどうだ？
支援品を割り当てておいたから
持っていくといい
今後の働きに期待してるぞ！
column4:
How is the progress of the investigation? I have
allocated support items, so it would be good to
bring them along. I am expecting great work from
you in the future!

column3:
調査の成果が出始めているな
厳しい状況に変わりはないが
この調子で進めていこう
column4:
The results of the investigation are beginning to
show, but the situation remains severe. Let's
continue in this way.

column3:
お前の隊もいつも頑張ってくれている
支援品を少し大目に持っていくといい
今後も期待してるぞ！
column4:
Your squad always does a great job, too.
You can take a little extra support supplies with
you!
I'm looking forward to seeing more of you in the
future!

column3:
ふむ、この調査隊の中でも
ずば抜けた動きをしているのが
お前の隊だろう！
さすがはジョゼフ様のお墨付きだ！
column4:
Hmmm, of all these survey teams, the one that
stands out from the rest is yours!
That's what I'm talking about, Masters Joseph's
endorsement!

column3:
走り回ればそれだけ消耗もしているだろう
支援品の割り当てを増やしておくから
遠慮せずに持っていってくれ
column4:
If you keep running around, you'll exhaust
yourself even more.
I'll increase the allocation of support items, so
please don't hesitate to take them.

column3:
それにしても、拠点にできるような
状態の良い洞窟を早々に発見できたのは
本当に幸運だったな！
column4:
Regardless, being able to quickly discover a cave
in such a good condition, that could serve as a
base was truly fortunate!

column3:
島の南の方にある洞窟を知っているか？
調査隊内では《不浄の掃き溜め》と
呼んでいる洞窟だ
column4:
Do you know about the cave located in the
southern part of the island? Within our expedition
team, we refer to it as the "Cesspool of Filth".

column3:
実はあそこも、この洞窟と同時期に
発見していたんだが
ここと違って、内部が凄まじい状態でな
column4:
Actually, we also discovered that place around
the same time as this cave.
But unlike here, the interior is in a terrible
state.

column3:
何らかの肉食獣が棲みついていたのか
そこら辺に腐った死肉が散乱して――
臭いもそれはひどいもんだった！
column4:
Some kind of predator was living in the area.
